text: So here are the different animals These are familiar kinds of things that are easy for us to recognize as having some kind of mind And Adam, of course, is different in a way from all of these And it suggests that this is the sort of thing we need to understand And once we've got all of these, then we're done And I think this is going to have to profoundly change But what's interesting about this is that in this ancient kind of biblical story, the idea was that Adam had to be the one to name the animals
content_summary: The speaker discusses the concept of cognition in animals, drawing comparisons with human cognition, specifically using the biblical character Adam. The speaker suggests a need for a deeper understanding of these cognitive differences and their implications.
